titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Independent Order of Odd Fellows Magnolia Lodge No. 166 manuscript 1973.163
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-08T14:23-0500

did.unittitle: Independent Order of Odd Fellows Magnolia Lodge No. 166 manuscript

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Independent Order of Oddfellows Magnolia Lodge No. 166 manuscript, 1973.163, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819. It became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. The IOOF's Magnolia Lodge was founded in Brooklyn, N.Y. in June 1845. It was an outgrowth of Brooklyn Lodge No. 26.

list.head: Source:
list.item: Independent Order of Odd Fellows. "About Us: To Improve and Elevate the Character of Man." Accessed April 13, 2011. http://www.ioof.org/aboutus.html

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One bound manuscript recording the history of Brooklyn's IOOF Magnolia Lodge No. 166 for the period 1845 to 1870. The manuscript is accompanied by a printed chart detailing the activities of the Lodge and its presiding officers during the period 1845 to 1875.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society holds two additional archival collections relating to the IOOF in Brooklyn:

list.item: 1973.310, Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book, 1855-1856
ARC.147, Fraternal organizations of Brooklyn collection, 1845-1997
